sen.j: 野宮 定基（ののみや さだもと、寛文9年7月14日 (旧暦)（1669年8月10日） - 正徳 (日本)元年6月29日 (旧暦)（1711年8月13日））は江戸時代中期の公家。
sen.e: Sadamoto NONOMIYA (August 10, 1669 - August 13, 1711) was a court noble, who lived during the middle of the Edo Period.
Sadamoto NONOMIYA (August 10, 1669 - August 13, 1711) was a court noble in the middle of the Edo Period.
Sadamoto NONOMIYA (August 10, 1669 - August 13, 1711) was a court noble in the middle of the Edo Period.
He was a scholar of Japanese classical literature.
He was a scholar of Japanese classical literature.
He was a scholar of Japanese classical literature.
He was the second son of Michishige NAKANOIN
He was the second son of Michishige NAKANOIN.
He was the second son of Michishige NAKANOIN.
His mother was the daughter of Masanobu OGASAWARA.
His mother was a daughter of Masanobu OGASAWARA.
sen.cmt: 「娘」は一人とは限らないのでtheではなくaにします。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Masanobu OGASAWARA.
His original name was Chikashige CHUIN (中院親茂)
sen.cmt: 中院親茂→正式な読み方が不明です：Chikashige CHUIN (中院親茂)としました。
sen.e: His original name was Chikashige CHUIN (中院親茂)
His original name was Chikashige CHUIN (中院親茂)

sen.j: 正室は清閑寺煕房の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Hirofusa SEIKANJI
His lawful wife was a daughter of Hirofusa SEIKANJI.
sen.cmt: 「娘」は一人とは限らないのでtheではなくaにします。
sen.e: His lawful wife was a daughter of Hirofusa SEIKANJI.

sen.j: 子に娘（野宮定俊室）、娘（庭田重孝室）、娘（大久保忠方室）、養子に野宮定俊。
sen.e: Sadatoshi NONOMIYA's wife, Shigetaka NIWATA's wife and Tadakata OKUBO's wife were his daughters, and Sadatoshi NONOMIYA was his adopted son.
Sadatoshi NONOMIYA's wife, Shigetaka NIWATA's wife and Tadakata OKUBO's wife were his daughters, and Sadatoshi NONOMIYA was his adopted son.
Sadatoshi NONOMIYA's wife, Shigetaka NIWATA's wife and Tadakata OKUBO's wife were his daughters, and Sadatoshi NONOMIYA was his adopted son.

sen.j: 叔父の野宮定縁の跡を継ぎ、定基と改名。
sen.e: He succeeded his uncle, Sadayori NOMIYA, and changed his name to Sadamoto.
He succeeded his uncle, Sadayori NOMIYA, and changed his name to Sadamoto.
He succeeded his uncle, Sadayori NOMIYA, and changed his name to Sadamoto.
He took over the reign of the Nonomiya family.
He took over the head of the Nonomiya family.
sen.cmt: 「のみや」か「ののみや」か、どちらが正しいか不明です。
sen.e: He took over the head of the Nonomiya family.
His pseudonym was Shodo (松堂)
sen.cmt: 松堂→正式な読み方が不明です：Shodo (松堂)としました。
sen.e: His pseudonym was Shodo (松堂)
His pseudonym was Shodo (松堂)

sen.j: 漢学に明るく、和歌をはじめとする諸学・諸芸にも深く通ず。
sen.e: He had a profound knowledge of not only Sinology but also other learnings and arts including waka poetry.
He had a profound knowledge not only of Sinology but also of other learnings and arts including waka poetry.
sen.cmt: 前置詞とその目的語をセットにして扱います。切り離しません。
sen.e: He had a profound knowledge not only of Sinology but also of other learnings and arts including waka poetry.

sen.j: 高橋宗恒について、故実を学び有職故実に詳しい。
sen.e: He learned ancient practices under Munetsune TAKAHASHI, and he was well informed of Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette)
He learned ancient practices under Munetsune TAKAHASHI, and he was well informed of Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette)
He learned ancient practices under Munetsune TAKAHASHI, and he was well informed of Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette)

sen.j: 同時代における著明な有識家として後世に名を残す。
sen.e: His name was recorded as one of the prominent intellectuals who lived during this period.
His name was recorded as one of the prominent intellectuals who lived during this period.
His name was recorded as one of the prominent intellectuals who lived during this period.

sen.j: 『黄白問答』(新野問答)は定基が新井白石の問いに答えたもの。
sen.e: "Ohaku Mondo" (Ohaku dialogue or Niino [Arai - Nonomiya] dialogue) was a collection of dialogues in which Sadamoto replied to the questions asked by Hakuseki ARAI
sen.cmt: 『黄白問答』(新野問答)→定訳不明："Ohaku Mondo" (Ohaku dialogue or Niino [Arai - Nonomiya] dialogue) としました。
sen.e: "Ohaku Mondo" (Ohaku dialogue or Niino [Arai - Nonomiya] dialogue) was a collection of dialogues in which Sadamoto replied to the questions asked by Hakuseki ARAI.
"Ohaku Mondo" (Ohaku dialogue or Niino [Arai - Nonomiya] dialogue) was a collection of dialogues in which Sadamoto replied to the questions asked by Hakuseki ARAI.

sen.j: 『定基卿記』からは、当時の複雑な公家社会の様子を垣間見ることが出来る。
sen.e: "Sadamotokyo ki" (Record of Sadamoto NONOMURA) gives us a glimpse into the complicated society of court nobles at that period.
sen.cmt: 『定基卿記』→定訳不明："Sadamotokyo ki" (Record of Sadamoto NONOMURA) としました。
sen.e: "Sadamotokyo ki" (Record of Sadamoto NONOMURA) gives us a glimpse into the complicated society of court nobles at that period.
"Sadamotokyo ki" (Record of Sadamoto NONOMURA) gives us a glimpse into the complicated society of court nobles at that period.

sen.j: 著書に『本朝実記』『平家物語考』『野宮日記』『群記類鑑』『定基歌集』『新野問答』等がある。
sen.e: He wrote the following books: "Honcho Jikki" (Imperial court fact record), "Heike Monogatari Ko" (A study on the Tale of the Heike), "Nonomiya Nikki" (Diary of Sadamoto NONOMIYA), "Gunki Ruikan" (Record of historical matters of Kamo-jinja Shrine), "Sadamoto Kashu" (Collection of waka poems by Sadamoto), "Niino Mondo" (Ohaku Mondo [Arai - Nonomiya dialogue]).
sen.cmt: 『本朝実記』→定訳不明："Honcho Jikki" (Imperial court fact record)としました。『平家物語考』→定訳不明："Heike Monogatari Ko" (A study on the Tale of the Heike)としました。 『野宮日記』→定訳不明："Nonomiya Nikki" (Diary of Sadamoto NONOMIYA)としました。 『群記類鑑』→定訳不明："Gunki Ruikan" (Record of historical matters of Kamo-jinja Shrine) としました。 『定基歌集』→定訳不明："Sadamoto Kashu" (Collection of waka poems by Sadamoto)としました。『新野問答』→定訳不明："Niino Mondo" (Ohaku Mondo [Arai - Nonomiya dialogue])としました。
sen.e: He wrote books including "Honcho Jikki" (Imperial court fact record), "Heike Monogatari Ko" (A study on the Tale of the Heike), "Nonomiya Nikki" (Diary of Sadamoto NONOMIYA), "Gunki Ruikan" (Record of historical matters of Kamo-jinja Shrine), "Sadamoto Kashu" (Collection of waka poems by Sadamoto), and "Niino Mondo" (Ohaku Mondo [Arai - Nonomiya dialogue]).
sen.cmt: the following books:とすると列挙した本しか著書がないように読めます。
sen.e: He wrote books including "Honcho Jikki" (Imperial court fact record), "Heike Monogatari Ko" (A study on the Tale of the Heike), "Nonomiya Nikki" (Diary of Sadamoto NONOMIYA), "Gunki Ruikan" (Record of historical matters of Kamo-jinja Shrine), "Sadamoto Kashu" (Collection of waka poems by Sadamoto), and "Niino Mondo" (Ohaku Mondo [Arai - Nonomiya dialogue]).
He died in 1711.
He died in 1711.
He died in 1711.
He was 43 years old.
He was 43 years old then.
sen.cmt: thenを補うことによって「死亡時の年齢」であることを示します。
sen.e: He was 43 years old then.
